Parameters

Return values
Notapplicable
static int32_t UartSci_control ( UART_Handle  handle,
uint32_t  cmd,
void *  arg 
)
static

Description
The function is the registered callback function which is invoked when the UART Driver instance is being passed a control command.

Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the UART Driver
[in]cmdUART command
[in]argOpaque handle to the argument
Return values
Success- 0
Error- UART Error code

static uint32_t UartSci_isFramingError ( const volatile SCIRegs *  ptrSCIRegs)
static

Description
Utility function which is used to determine if there is a framing error or not?

Parameters
[in]ptrSCIRegsPointer to the SCI Base
Return values
1- Framing error has been detected
0- Framing error has not been detected

static uint32_t UartSci_isRxFree ( const volatile SCIRegs *  ptrSCIRegs)
static

Description
Utility function which is used to determine if the SCI receiver is free or not.

Parameters
[in]ptrSCIRegsPointer to the SCI Base
Return values
1- Receiver is free
0- Receiver is not free
static uint32_t UartSci_isRxInterruptEnabled ( const volatile SCIRegs *  ptrSCIRegs)
static

Description
Utility function which is used to check if the transmit interrupt for the specific SCI Instance is enabled or not

Parameters
[in]ptrSCIRegsPointer to the SCI Base
Return values
1- Interrupt is enabled
0- Interrupt is disabled
static uint32_t UartSci_isRxOverrun ( const volatile SCIRegs *  ptrSCIRegs)
static

Description
Utility function which is used to determine if the SCI receiver has been overrun or not?

Parameters
[in]ptrSCIRegsPointer to the SCI Base
Return values
1- Receiver overrun has been detected
0- Receiver overrun not detected
static uint32_t UartSci_isTxFree ( const volatile SCIRegs *  ptrSCIRegs)
static

Description
Utility function which is used to determine if the SCI transmitter is free or not.

Parameters
[in]ptrSCIRegsPointer to the SCI Base
Return values
1- Transmitter is free
0- Transmitter is not free
static uint32_t UartSci_isTxInterruptEnabled ( const volatile SCIRegs *  ptrSCIRegs)
static

Description
Utility function which is used to check if the transmit interrupt for the specific SCI Instance is enabled or not

Parameters
[in]ptrSCIRegsPointer to the SCI Base
Return values
1- Interrupt is enabled
0- Interrupt is disabled
int32_t UartSci_noDMAClose ( UartSci_Driver *  ptrUartSciDriver)

Description
The function is used to close the no DMA interface layer.

Parameters
[in]ptrUartSciDriverPointer to the UART driver for which the DMA is being closed
Return values
Success- Always return 0
int32_t UartSci_noDMAInitiateRxDMA ( UartSci_Driver *  ptrUartSciDriver,
uint32_t  dstAddress,
uint32_t  numBytes,
bool  pollingMode 
)

Description
The function is used to initiate the receive DMA. For the No DMA this should never be invoked and is a stub error catching function.

Parameters
[in]ptrUartSciDriverPointer to the UART Driver Instance
[in]dstAddressDestination address of the buffer where the data is to be placed
[in]numBytesNumber of bytes to be transmitted
[in]pollingModeSet to true to indicate that we need to poll for completion else set to false
Return values
Success- 0
ErrorCode - <0
int32_t UartSci_noDMAInitiateTxDMA ( UartSci_Driver *  ptrUartSciDriver,
uint32_t  srcAddress,
uint32_t  numBytes,
bool  pollingMode 
)

Description
The function is used to initiate the transmit DMA. For the No DMA this should never be invoked and is a stub error catching function.

Parameters
[in]ptrUartSciDriverPointer to the UART Driver Instance
[in]srcAddressSource address of the buffer which is to be transmitted
[in]numBytesNumber of bytes to be transmitted
[in]pollingModeSet to true to indicate that we need to poll for completion else set to false
Return values
Success- 0
ErrorCode - <0
bool UartSci_noDMAIsDMAEnabled ( UartSci_Driver *  ptrUartSciDriver)

Description
The function returns the status of the DMA configuration.

Parameters
[in]ptrUartSciDriverPointer to the UART Driver Instance
Return values
false- DMA Services are always disabled
int32_t UartSci_noDMAOpen ( UartSci_Driver *  ptrUartSciDriver,
UartSci_HwCfg *  ptrHwCfg 
)

Description
The function is used to open the No-DMA. This is a stub function which always succeeds.

Parameters
[in]ptrUartSciDriverPointer to the UART SCI Driver
[in]ptrHwCfgPointer to the UART SCI Hardware configuration
Return values
Success- Always return 0
static UART_Handle UartSci_open ( UART_Handle  handle,
UART_Params *  params 
)
static

Description
The function is the registered callback function which is invoked when the UART Driver instance is being opened with a specific application supplied arguments.

Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the UART Driver
[in]paramsUART Parameters with which the driver is being opened
Return values
Success- Driver Handle
Error- NULL

)

Parameters

[in]chCharacter to be placed
Return values
Notapplicable
static int32_t UartSci_read ( UART_Handle  handle,
uint8_t *  buffer,
uint32_t  size 
)
static

Description
The function is the registered callback function which is invoked when the data is to be read from the UART Driver. This function implements a semaphore blocking operation if the UART driver instance is configured to operate in BLOCKING mode.

Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the UART Driver
[in]bufferPointer to the data buffer
[in]sizeSize of the data which needs to be read
Return values
Success- Number of bytes which have been read
Error- UART Error code
static void UartSci_readCancel ( UART_Handle  handle)
static

Description
The function is the registered callback function which is invoked when the a previous data read operation has to be cancelled.

Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the UART Driver
Return values
Notapplicable
static void UartSci_readChar ( UartSci_Driver *  ptrUartSciDriver,
UartSci_HwCfg *  ptrHwCfg 
)
static

Description
The function is used to read the character and place this into the read buffer.

Parameters
[in]ptrUartSciDriverPointer to the UART Driver Instance
[in]ptrHwCfgPointer to the UART Driver Hardware configuration
Return values
Notapplicable
static int32_t UartSci_readPolling ( UART_Handle  handle,
uint8_t *  buffer,
uint32_t  size 
)
static

Description
The function is the registered callback function which is invoked when the data is to be read in polling mode from the UART Driver. The function will loop around till all the buffer is completely filled up or if the new line character is received.

Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the UART Driver
[in]bufferPointer to the data buffer
[in]sizeSize of the data which needs to be read
Return values
Success- Number of bytes which have been read
Error- UART Error code
static int32_t UartSci_validateParams ( UART_Params *  params,
UartSci_HwCfg *  ptrHwCfg 
)
static

Description
The function is used to validate the arguments

Parameters
[in]paramsUART Parameters to be validated
[in]ptrHwCfgPointer to the hardware configuration
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0
static int32_t UartSci_write ( UART_Handle  handle,
uint8_t *  buffer,
uint32_t  size 
)
static

Description
The function is the registered callback function which is invoked when the data is to be written to the UART Driver. This function implements a semaphore blocking operation if the UART driver instance is configured to operate in BLOCKING mode.

Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the UART Driver
[in]bufferPointer to the data buffer
[in]sizeSize of the data to be written
Return values
Success- Number of bytes which have been transferred
Error- UART Error code
static void UartSci_writeCancel ( UART_Handle  handle)
static

Description
The function is the registered callback function which is invoked when the UART Driver write operations are ben canceled.

Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the UART Driver
Return values
Notapplicable
static void UartSci_writeChar ( UartSci_Driver *  ptrUartSciDriver,
UartSci_HwCfg *  ptrHwCfg 
)
static

Description
The function is used to write the character from the write buffer on the UART.

Parameters
[in]ptrUartSciDriverPointer to the UART Driver Instance
[in]ptrHwCfgPointer to the UART Driver Hardware configuration
Return values
Notapplicable
static int32_t UartSci_writePolling ( UART_Handle  handle,
uint8_t *  buffer,
uint32_t  size 
)
static

Description
The function is the registered callback function which is invoked when the data is to be written to the UART Driver but this will poll the UART driver in a while loop and will only return once all the data has been sent out.

Parameters
[in]handleHandle to the UART Driver
[in]bufferPointer to the data buffer
[in]sizeSize of the data to be written
Return values
Success- Number of bytes which have been transferred
Error- UART Error code
